siteMetadata.title: Colm Doyle
siteMetadata.subtitle: Thoughts on Technology, Developer Relations and more.

frontmatter.title: Flexibility shouldn't mean always-on
frontmatter.description: A strict Monday to Friday, nine to five schedule is no longer the norm for many people who work in software, but you need to be sure that 'choosing when you work' doesn't make you always available to work.

frontmatter.title: When you struggle to write
frontmatter.description: When a large part of your job is content creation, what can you do when you're struggling to get your creative juices flowing? Here's some approaches I take when writer's block strikes.

frontmatter.title: Getting better at Developer Relations
frontmatter.description: Six things that I recommend to help people refine the craft of working with their Developer Community

frontmatter.title: The real perk
frontmatter.description: Tech companies do a fantastic job on their career sites of talking about all the amazing perks they offer. Free food as far as the eye can see, the latest hardware and eye-popping salaries. But at the best companies, the real perk is something else.
